entry.title: Calculation of YTD Last year in the model - SAP ANALYTICS CLOUD
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm trying to calculate last year's YTD in the model, but the standard YTD formula doesn't seem to work because I'm also using the PREVIOUS function in the calculation. As a result, no data appears in the measure. Do you know a formula that can calculate last year's YTD in the model?

entry.title: Need CDS View for Ocean Freight Booking Details and Reporting – SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We are working in SAP Public Cloud Grow Edition and have created freight bookings in the Manage Ocean Freight Booking application.

Now we want to retrieve booking details (i.e., Port of Loading, discharge, Vessel, Voyage and other related fields) for implementing further business solutions, but we are unable to find any released CDS view which can be utilized for the same.

Please guide us by providing the released CDS view from which this information can be retrieved.

We also need CDS views to create queries for reporting purposes, as the current queries are deprecated.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Need CDS View for Ocean Freight Booking Details and R...
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

  • Retrieving Freight Booking Details (Vessel, Voyage, Port of Loading, etc.)

The necessary booking details are available across the following released CDS Views, which are classified as C1 released (suitable for consumption and custom logic implementation):

  • For Vessel and Voyage: Please utilize the CDS View I_TransportationOrderStage_2.

  • For Port of Loading and Discharge: Please utilize the CDS View I_TransportationOrderStop_2.

As these views are C1 released, you can use them internally within your S/4HANA Cloud environment for implementing further business solutions via Key User Extensibility.

Alternative for External Consumption

If you require this data for external consumption, you can utilize the available Freight Booking API:

Freight Booking API Documentation

  • CDS Views for Reporting Purposes

The same released CDS Views mentioned above (I_TransportationOrderStage_2 and I_TransportationOrderStop_2) are suitable for creating custom analytical queries for reporting purposes, replacing any deprecated queries you may be currently using.

We hope this guidance helps you proceed with your implementations. Please let us know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Content Security Policy: when SAP S/4HANA cares like a mother
entry.content:
Disclaimer: I was made aware of the fact that "don't talk to strangers" is actually not very good advice when it comes to safety of children. Reason:  such advice might prevent kids from seeking help from unknown adults. And situations where seeking help from random strangers is beneficial are more common than cases where talking to strangers is dangerous.

So to avoid any misunderstandings: this blog post is trying to give advice on CSPs, not on child safety. I just needed an attention-grabbing introduction.

I recommend to access our RISE with SAP Methodology and Experience learning journey. 

Understanding the RISE with SAP methodology is crucial for driving business transformation.

Start your journey today!

Prerequisites

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.


I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Test data refresh SAP service prior to go live
entry.content:
hello

I would like to know if I can use the test data refresh SAP service  with Prod data prior to go live to refresh the Test environment data created during  sprints testing  (some with errors) to simulate a global data migration mock up prior to start the UAT

Why : I want to delete all data created may be manually for sprint testing to be able to perform the UAT with data uploaded using data migration mock up to be able to simulate 100%  data migration upload and  check data quality and completeness prior to perform the UAT and not use bad quality data created during sprint testing

Context : SAP CLOUD ERP 2602, 3SL, Production environment will be created one we start the UAT without any custo nor data as we will be at the end of explore phase 

if not possible , what is the alternative solution to clean all my test env data ?

regards

entry.title: How to create a Worker via SOAP API in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Pre-requisite:

The Communication Arrangement for the scenario External HR Workforce Integration (SAP_COM_0301), needs to be setup in the Target System.

  1. Create a communication user using the Maintain Communication Users app.
    To create a New Communication User follow the below steps
    1. Go to the New button.

       

    2. Create the New Communication User (For Example I have taken the name “SOAP_API_0301”. Once you have filled in the required details

       

    3. Create it.
      2. Create a communication system using the Communication Systems app. For more information, refer to Maintain Communication Systems.
      1. Go to the app Communication Systems.
      2. Try to create a new Communication System and fill in the data in the fields (System Id, System Name and the Host name).

        For example: I have taken my Target system as CCF/708. The Host name will be “ccf-708.devsys.net.sap”.

         

      3. Now go to the Tab “Users for Inbound Communication” and add the newly created Communication User.
      4. The Authentication Method needs to be “UserName and Password”.
      5. Then Click on “OK”.
      6. Then Click on “Save” it.

         

3. Create a communication arrangement using the Communication Arrangement app (SAP_COM_0301).

  1. To create the Communication Arrangement, go to the App “Communication Arrangement”.
  2. Click on New.
  3. Put the scenario id SAP_COM_0301.
  4. Click on Create button.
  5. Maintain the New created Communication System (Example: SOAP_API_0301).
  6. Once you maintain the Communication System, the Inbound communication will be automatically populated based on the configuration before.
  7. Then Save it.

Steps to perform to the Worker Creation:

  1. Once the Communication Arrangement is setup correctly in the Target System, we are going to use Bruno to try to push the Payload and create the Worker.
  2. In Bruno, we will create a collection with the required name and the location. (For Example, we are using the collection CC3_708).

     

  3. Once that is done try Creating a New Request on the New Collection.
  4. In creation of the request, put in the Request Name (For Example: Creation of the Worker) with the Type “HTTP”.
  5. In the URL, the request should be the POST.

     

  6. The Request URL needs to be taken from the Target System from the app “Communication Arrangement” from the Inbound Services with the application protocol “SOAP”.

     

  7. Copy the URL and paste it in here.

     

  8. Then create it.
  9. Once the request is created in the Bruno, it will be showing up like the below screenshot.
  10. Navigate to the Body Tab set the type to be XML.
  11. Then put in the required XML Payload.
  12. Then Navigate to the Tab Header.

     

  13. Add Header with the below values
    Key: Content-Type
    Value: text/xml
  14. Once that is maintained, navigate to the “Auth” Tab. Change it to Basic Auth from Inherit.

     

  15. Once that is set up you need to take up username and password maintained in the app Communication Arrangement in the Inbound Communication part.
  16. Copy the authentication details (username and password) to the Auth section in Bruno.
  17. Then Save the request and execute it.
  18. Once that is executed correctly, it will show the status 200 OK.
  19. Then check for the Worker with the provided worker id/ Person UUID in the app “Manage Workforce” app.
  20. Now the Worker is created with provided details in the XML and with the Entry Source SOAP API(A).

For any further Information refer to the help documentation below,
Replicate Basic Master Data for Workforce from External HR Systems | SAP Help Portal.

In your answer, your are saying

"In scenarios where SAPGui and RFC connections are connected via the SAProuter, the source hostname (terminal name) is actually sent to the backend by the SAPGui/RFC client as part of the SAPGui/RFC protocol, and the backend can use this hostname/terminal name for security audit purpose. ".

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: ALV Background spool open as Excel file
entry.content:
It's not possible to send an Excel attachment via spool list recipient in SM37.

You may send only the formats specified in SCOT > Options > SMTP connections > Outbound > SMTP Node > Internet > Double click to see the options.

They are also described here: Formats | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Kickoff da Comunidade SAP BH (1º LOTE)
entry.content:
A Comunidade SAP BH está de volta!


Convidamos você para o nosso evento de kick-off presencial, marcando o retorno da Comunidade SAP Belo Horizonte. O encontro será realizado na sede da Localiza Labs.

Para participar, é necessário seguir os passos abaixo com atenção:

  1. Cadastre-se na Comunidade SAP Belo Horizonte.

  2. Confirme sua presença nesta página do evento.

  3. Complete seu credenciamento pelo formulário no Sympla — o link está disponível logo acima da imagem do mapa, no canto direito desta página.
    Se preferir pode usar o link por aqui: Inscrição no Evento

⚠️Atenção: Apenas confirmar presença aqui na página não garante sua entrada no evento. O preenchimento do formulário no Sympla é obrigatório para o credenciamento. Sem ele, não será possível acessar o local, pois o evento ocorrerá dentro da estrutura de uma empresa e as vagas são limitadas.

Contamos com sua participação para fortalecer ainda mais nossa comunidade!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 
Pauta do Kickoff da Comunidade SAP BH
 
O que te espera:
- Abertura e boas-vindas com apresentação do propósito e agenda do evento.
- Palestra sobre migração S/4HANA: aprendizados práticos e inspiradores rumo ao Clean Core.
- BTP em ação: como low-code, pro-code e automação simplificam o complexo e aceleram a inovação.
- Encerramento com chamado à ação: próximos passos e engajamento contínuo da comunidade.
- Happy Hour no rooftop: chopp, petiscos, música e muito networking para fortalecer conexões.
 
Venha viver esse momento histórico e fazer parte da construção do futuro da Comunidade SAP BH!

Orientação de transporte: Após o evento teremos happy hour com drinks no rooftop. Para curtir sem preocupações, dê preferência ao Uber ou apps de transporte.

entry.title: Re: ALV Background spool open as Excel file
entry.content:
Hello Geoff,

You can use class CL_SALV_BS_RUNTIME_INFO to get the AlV report contents in an internal table and download it as an excel or send as an email attachment without needing to send the report to spool. 
https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-blog-posts/gain-programmatic-access-to-data-of-sapgui-alv-reports/ba-p/12945057

Best Regards,

Siva

entry.title: Re: SAP Service Cloud - Exporting Internal Notes
entry.content:
Hello BusraKulahci,

*****See the comments section. You can pass the service ticket id directly to the Service Request Notes object in the DWB tool. So you don't need to perform some of the steps below to fetch the ticket object id.***** 

You can get this done using the DWB tool. To achieve this you will first need to get the tickets object id by exporting the tickets. Once you have the object ID of the ticket, you pass that as the parent object id for the service notes object.

For example, here is a ticket that has 2 notes.

Take the ticket id 1913636 and get its object id from the Service Request object. 

Then take the object id 0AB6C4C4B4871FE096E812F3BEFE95AB and put it in the parent object id field of the Service Request Notes object 

That will fetch you the notes associated with this ticket.

Julius

entry.title: SAP Datasphere – Existing Connections Suddenly Stopped Working After Cloud Connector Upgrade
entry.content:
Good day,

I hope someone can help me with the following issue.

In my company we use SAP Datasphere, and we already had three connections created. These connections had been working perfectly for a long time, and I was able to create Replication Flows and other objects consuming data from our source system (SAP S/4HANA).

However, two days ago all three connections suddenly stopped working. They are no longer usable, as shown in Image (1), where you can see the same error displayed for all three connections.

Our Basis support team tried upgrading the Cloud Connector to the latest available version, as shown in Image (2), but unfortunately this did not solve the issue.

We would appreciate any guidance or suggestions to help us resolve this problem.

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Re: Move SU with multiple item problem
entry.content:
A total of six enhancements must be implemented in the main program SAPML03T in order to pass the determined values to the main program SAPLL03B.

Includes to Enhance (implizit):

- ML03TFHU_LENUM_EINL_CHECK
- ML03TF20_T333_LESEN
- ML03TFBM_LEQUANTS_INT_LTAP
- ML03TF20_T340D_LESEN
- MLLVSFOR - FORM T340_LESEN
- ML03TF50_DATEN_LTAP_MLVS

Example in ML03TFBM_LEQUANTS_INT_LTAP:

* QUANTO Sebastian Wachter 06.11.2025 Daten korrekt anderem Rahmenprogramm bei externem Aufruf übergeben
FIELD-SYMBOLS <INT_LTAP> TYPE ANY TABLE.
ASSIGN ('(SAPLL03B)INT_LTAP[]') TO <INT_LTAP>.
IF <INT_LTAP> IS ASSIGNED.
IF <INT_LTAP>[] IS INITIAL.
<INT_LTAP>[] = INT_LTAP[].
ENDIF.
ENDIF.

Example in ML03TF20_T333_LESEN:
* QS S.Wachter 06.11.2025 In anderem Rahmenprogramm Daten korrekt setzen
FIELD-SYMBOLS <t333> TYPE any.
ASSIGN ('(SAPLL03B)T333') TO <t333>.
IF <t333> IS ASSIGNED.
IF <t333> IS INITIAL.
<t333> = t333.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.

entry.title: Issue in SAP MDK Data Table Control – setValue() Not Working
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on the SAP MDK Data Table control, where I need to set the value of one column based on the user-entered value in another column. The edit mode is set to Inline.

On the Save button, I have added the following rule to set the status:

let currentCell = context.getPageProxy().getControl('SectionedTable0').getSection('SectionDataTable0').getCell(0, 0);
const newValue = "Accepted";
currentCell.setValue(newValue);


I have referred to the following blog, but this approach doesn’t seem to work. I would appreciate any help or suggestions on this issue.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/what-s-new-in-mobile-development-kit-client-23-4/ba-p/13557735

 

I also tried the below code snippet, but it did not work either:

let currentCell = context.getControl('SectionedTable0').getSection('SectionDataTable0').getCell(0, 0);
const newValue = "My Product";
currentCell.setValue(newValue);

 


Thank you in advance for your help!
@bill_froelich 
@Jitendra_Kansal78

entry.title: Re: Working with the new My Timesheet App Version 4 (F3074A) and tasks time-reporting in PPM Project
entry.content:
Is it possible to enter the time directly on the PPM tasks in the app or CAT2??

In standard, for the timesheet to be submitted on PPM tasks, we need to assign/plan resources on the roles against the task and then it appears in the worklist of CAT2 from where you can book the hours. 
 
However,  We have many resources which can't be planned on PPM projects in advance. This unplanned resources will still need to book hours on tasks.
When we try to manually assign the task in CAT2, the system doesnt make the PPM project or task editable even though they are made as input field in the field selection config of data entry profile.
Neither we are able to add task manually in the assignment in the app.

Appreciate your help!

entry.content: only basic authentication is supported

entry.title: OData Service FAA_ASSET_OVERVIEWPAGE (Entity Set C_AssetBalanceOverviewResult)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

When trying to fetch data from the entity set C_AssetBalanceOverviewResult of the OData service FAA_ASSET_OVERVIEWPAGE, I encountered an issue related to the input parameters.

The service metadata for C_AssetBalanceOverviewParameters exposes the following parameters:
P_CompanyCode
P_CurrencyRole
P_FiscalPeriod
P_FiscalYear
P_Ledger
However, in the underlying CDS Data Definition C_AssetBalanceOverview, I see additional parameters:
define view C_AssetBalanceOverview
with parameters
P_TodayDate : fagl_keydate,
P_AssetAccountingKeyFigureSet : faa_key_figure_set,
P_CompanyCode : fis_bukrs,
P_Ledger : fis_rldnr,
P_FiscalYear : fis_ryear,
P_FiscalPeriod : fis_poper,
P_CurrencyRole : fis_curtp,
P_FiscalPeriodEndDate : fagl_keydate (derived automatically)

The parameters P_TodayDate and P_AssetAccountingKeyFigureSet are marked with @Consumption.hidden, so they are not visible in the OData metadata.

When I call the OData service and provide only the visible parameters:
P_CompanyCode
P_CurrencyRole
P_FiscalPeriod
P_FiscalYear
P_Ledger
I receive a short dump: CX_SADL_DUMP_APPL_MODEL_ERROR in object FAA_ASSET_OVERVIEWPAGE.

Question:

  1. Are the parameters being passed correctly according to the design of this CDS consumption view and OData service?

  2. How should the hidden parameters (P_TodayDate and P_AssetAccountingKeyFigureSet) be handled when calling the OData service?

  3. Is there a known workaround or recommended approach to avoid the CX_SADL_DUMP_APPL_MODEL_ERROR for this scenario?

Any guidance or reference documentation would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: How to Create a Tile Pointing to dynamic URL : S/4Hana
entry.content:
Hello @Jocelyn_Dart  

We have a similar requirement where we would like to create Tiles in S/4 Fiori Launchpad (2023 Private Cloud) for custom CAP apps deployed in BTP. 

I did the below steps:

  1. SM59 --> Defined new RFC type G "TEST_BTP2FLP_G" pointing to host of BTP 
  2. SM30 -> /UI2/V_SYSALIAS --> Defined new Sys Alias "TEST_BTP" 
  3. SM30 -> /UI2/V_ALIASMAP --> Defined new Alias mapping using Source = "TEST_BTP" and Target = "TEST_BTP2FLP"
  4. /IWFND/ROUTING -> added entry using System Alias = "TEST_BTP2FLP" and RFC destination = "TEST_BTP2FLP_G" 
  5. Created target mapping with fixed part of URL and Alias = "TEST_BTP"
  6. Create Tile for the sem obj and action defined in step 5

When opening the Tile, it goes to a URL constructed as <S/4_HOST>/FIXED_URL instead of going to <BTP_HOST>/FIXED_URL. 

Do you have any documentation on how should we do this kind of integration? Customer would like to have a single entry point for all the apps. 

Thank you!

Lucian

entry.title: Impact of rfc/callback_security_method Setting on Optimizer Functionality
entry.content:
We are experiencing issues with the parameter rfc/callback_security_method currently set to 3 in our SAP RISE environment.
Problem:

When the parameter is set to 3, the RCC_VERSION transaction and RCCF TM Optimizer do not work as expected.
The system generates an ABAP short dump with error:
CALLBACK_REJECTED_BY_WHITELIST
RFC callback call rejected by positive list

This prevents optimizer functionality, which is critical for planning and execution processes.

  1. What is the best way to resolve this issue while keeping the system secure?
    • Should we configure the whitelist for required RFC callbacks?
    • Or is it acceptable to temporarily change the parameter value from 3 to 1?

2. What is the impact if we maintain the parameter value as 1?

  • Are there any major security risks beyond allowing RFC callbacks?
  • Will this affect other components or system stability?

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Impact of rfc/callback_security_method Setting on Opt...
entry.content:
Hello,

The recommendation is to set the rfc/callback_security_method parameter to 3 and adjust the allowlist per the CALLBACK_REJECTED_BY_WHITELIST dumps that are going to be generated.

The only impact the parameter has is on the RFC callback handling. You can read more about this on KBA 3349924 - Impacts of the parameter rfc/callback_security_method.

 

Best regards.

entry.title: Re: Manual Switch off of the distribution of manual accru...
entry.content:
Hi @HariBoyapati2 , 

To introduce more flexibility into your process, you could create two separate Settlement Document Types, one with distribution enabled and one without distribution, both linked to the same Settlement Process Type. This setup will not only give you better control over how settlements are processed but will also make it easier to analyze and report by document type.

Then, during manual settlement creation, you can simply select the appropriate document type based on whether distribution is needed for that scenario.

Also, depending on your use case, you may need to configure or adjust the “Entry Type for Manual Settlement” (MAN_SETTL_ENTRY_TYPE) in the Condition Contract Settlement Settings to ensure the system behavior aligns with your expected process flow.

Regards, 
Gauthier VICTOR

entry.title: Effortless SAPUI5 Patch Management: Introducing the New SAPUI5 Runtime Repository
entry.content:
For years, the MIME repository has been the standard location for storing SAPUI5 runtime artifacts for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. In contrast, the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition retrieves SAPUI5 from the cloud CDN. Although the MIME repository has served its purpose, many customers working with SAPUI5, especially system operators installing new SAPUI5 patches, face common challenges. These include poor performance, numerous manual steps, issues with transports, and risk of inconsistent states.

The good news is that SAP introduces the SAPUI5 Runtime Repository with the release of SAP S/4HANA 2025. This modern replacement overcomes these challenges and prepares you for the next generation of SAPUI5. To ensure efficiency for all customers, downports to all maintained lower releases are available, except for SAP S/4HANA 1809 using SAPUI5 1.38. You can access this repository through SAP Notes containing transport-based correction instructions (TCIs).

Let's explore how this new repository significantly enhances your workflow.

Performance Where It Matters

  • MIME Repository: SAPUI5 patch updates can take up to 2 hours. Loading debug-sources with sap-ui-debug=true can take up to 10 minutes.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Patch upgrades are approximately 20 times faster. During runtime, loading debug sources also occurs about 20 times faster. These improvements ensure smoother operations and faster response times.

From Complexity to Simplicity

  • MIME Repository: Handles more than 70,000 individual ABAP objects. This volume poses a risk of errors and inconsistent updates.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: All runtime content is bundled into just one ABAP object. This approach guarantees consistent updates and reduces operational risks.

Automation First

  • MIME Repository: Updates rely on custom, manual procedures, which increases the maintenance effort.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Uses SAP TCI Notes and comes with an automated process specifically for SAP S/4HANA cloud operations. This makes updates easier and more reliable.

Zero Downtime Deployments

  • MIME Repository: No support for zero-downtime deployments. This limitation might cause interruptions during system upgrades.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Fully supports online deployment with zero downtime. This feature ensures that SAPUI5 content remains continuously available, even during system upgrades.

Safe, Standardized Rollbacks

  • MIME Repository: Reverting patches can be error-prone, often requiring manual fixes and risking inconsistent system states.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Reverting SAPUI5 patches is fully supported. Runtime content is delivered as a single ABAP object, and the update process integrates with TCIs. Rollbacks are straightforward, consistent, and safe. This approach simplifies the validation of new patches: if issues arise, you can reliably revert to the previous stable state without lengthy manual intervention or risking inconsistencies across systems.

Future-Proof 

  • MIME Repository: Not compatible with multiple SAPUI5 versions.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Supports multiple SAPUI5 versions in parallel, making it ready for the future while ensuring backward compatibility.

Here's an overview of all the improvements:

Why This Matters

The move from MIME Repository to the new SAPUI5 Runtime Repository isn’t just a technical upgrade — it’s a significant step toward:

  • Faster and safer patch updates.
  • Reduced operational effort.
  • Continuous availability.
  • Future compatibility.

If your organization uses on-premise landscapes and works with SAPUI5, it's time to embrace this change: the SAPUI5 Runtime Repository becomes automatically available with the current SAP S/4HANA 2025 release and in the latest support packages of all maintained SAP S/4HANA versions except SAP S/4HANA 1809.

Even if you do not want to upgrade to a new support package, you can still use the SAPUI5 runtime repository by installing SAP Note 3599156. If you have hesitated to install a new SAPUI5 patch, now is the time to try the new procedure and benefit from its efficacy and ease. Installing the latest SAPUI5 patches ensures your applications run efficiently today and are prepared for the future.

👉Have you performed any SAPUI5 patch upgrades recently? What has your experience been like so far? To get started, refer to SAP Note 3599156.

entry.title: How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace
entry.content:
How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace

Introduction

The modern workplace has changed dramatically. Employees no longer rely solely on static intranets or scattered collaboration tools. Instead, they expect a connected, personalized experience that helps them cut through the noise and focus on meaningful work. Enter artificial intelligence (AI).

AI isn’t just another layer of technology- it’s rapidly becoming the backbone of digital workspaces. By surfacing the right information at the right time, automating repetitive tasks, and enabling smarter collaboration and self-service, AI is redefining how we work, learn, and engage every day.

With digital workspaces in SAP Build, these AI capabilities are already available today—helping organizations deliver intelligent, personalized employee experiences out of the box

The Rise of AI in the Digital Workspace

For years, digital workspaces have been a central hub for business applications, documents, apps, and communications in one place. Useful—but often overwhelming. Employees spent as much time searching for information as they did, acting on it.

Now, AI is filling the gaps. With intelligent copilots, content curation, and contextual answers, digital workspaces like SAP Build Work Zone have evolved from being a destination for information into an engine for productivity and engagement.

Core AI features available today in SAP Build digital workspaces

1. Chatbots & Virtual Assistants
With Joule, SAP’s AI copilot, workspace users can access information instantly. From answering HR questions to surfacing insights from reports, employees can rely on conversational AI to get what they need instantaneously.

Joule, SAP's AI copilot integrated into the digital workspace

2. Task completion with Joule Skills

One can enhance Joule capabilities by creating skills for it in Joule Studio. Connected with SAP systems and third-party applications, Joule can complete tasks like submitting time-off requests, approving workflows, or surfacing KPI dashboards—all from a single interface

  

3. Document Grounding Capabilities
Joule ensures information is both contextual and reliable when using workspace content to ground AI responses. For example, employees can ask “What’s our travel policy in Europe?” and receive an AI response sourced directly from workspace content or SAP SuccessFactors policies when it is enabled as an AI source.

  

4. Content generation and summarization using generative AI
SAP Build leverages generative AI to help users create and refine content—whether drafting announcements, summarizing updates, or suggesting language for a blog post—directly within the workspace.

  

 

 

 

 

Real-Life Examples in Action

  • Information access with grounded responses

Joule responds with answers grounded in the specific workspace content. Employees can query Joule with specific questions like “What is the holiday plan for next year in Germany" or “how can I apply for a sabbatical leave? Point me to the relevant file”.

  • Smart document summaries

Integrated AI services capture the highlights of a workspace document—policy highlights, key insights from data, or high-level overview of a blog.

  • Workflow Automation

From within SAP Build workspace, an employee can ask Joule to “create a purchase order” or “show current pipeline metrics.” The copilot triggers the workflow in connected SAP systems, making productivity seamless.

  • Intelligent content curation

Users can easily create blog posts, feed posts or even knowledge articles in the workspace using the native AI features with simple prompts like “create a workspace feed reminding members to fill their timesheet in a funny and casual tone”.

The Business Impact

  • Faster Information Access: Joule makes information searches 95% faster by surfacing insights and data instantly. Grounded insights reduce time spent searching for answers.
  • Reduced Manual Effort: Generative AI-assisted summarization and content creation free up employee time.
  • Better Governance: AI responses in SAP are backed by enterprise content, ensuring compliance and accuracy.

Preparing for the AI-Powered Workspace

Adopting AI in digital workspaces is not just about flipping a switch—it’s about preparing your organization:

  • Change Management: Train employees to adopt AI workflows and copilots in their daily work.
  • Governance: Define guardrails for AI-generated content, data privacy, and security.
  • Integration: Maximize value by connecting SAP Build with existing SAP and non-SAP applications, making copilots more powerful.

Conclusion

AI is no longer a future trend; it’s already embedded in the digital workspaces employees use today. With embedded AI and Joule, organizations don’t just imagine an intelligent workspace—they experience it

By weaving AI into daily workflows—whether through copilots, recommended learning, or curated content—SAP Build helps organizations unlock productivity, agility, and engagement at scale.

Ready to take the next step?

Learn more about these capabilities and their implementation from the following resources:

  1. Joule integration with Work Zone
  2. SAP Build Work Zone Gets Even More Powerful with AI-Powered Capabilities
  3. Set Up Document Grounding | SAP Help Portal
  4. Integration With Document Grounding | SAP Help Portal
  5. Enabling AI Features | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Re: Depreciation Keys - Reducing Balance Method
entry.content:
HI @SamadDandiya 

Below table explains the issue with potential approach to solution.

Requirement / IssueECC BehaviorS/4HANA Public Cloud LimitationPublic Cloud Compliant SolutionHow to Configure (Expert Configuration)
Use of custom reducing-balance percentages (e.g., 33.33%, 26.7%, 13.33%)Maintained in Multi-Level MethodCannot create new multi-level methodsCreate new depreciation keys and maintain percentages directlyIn “Define Depreciation Key”, enter DB rate (e.g., 33.33%) in Rate field
Multiple rates over different life periodsMulti-level method supports multi-layer %Cloud does not allow new multi-level layersUse Phase Control inside depreciation keyCreate Phase 1, Phase 2, Phase 3 with different DB rates
Switching rate after specific yearsMulti-level method supports this automaticallyCloud restricts layer creationConfigure Year-based Phase ChangesSet “From Useful Life Year” and “To Year” per phase
Declining balance applied on APCBase value defined in multi-level methodNo new base value method allowedUse Standard Base Value = APC (method 01)In depreciation key → Base Value: standard setting
Different % in each phase (ex: Yr 1–3 = 33.33%, Yr 4–8 = 26.7%, Yr 9+ = 13.33%)Multi-level method defines each levelCloud multi-level method lockedReplicate using Phase Control + DB ratesDefine three phases with specific % for each phase
Need to maintain client-specific custom %ECC allowed any %Cloud restricts creation only in multi-level methodYou can freely maintain % inside depreciation keyEnter any % (e.g., 26.7%) directly in the key
Requirement to replicate exact ECC valuesECC multi-level methods designed for custom rulesNot possible to duplicate multi-level methodCloud-aligned method using phases produces same valuesTest using “Depreciation Simulation” app

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Capitalization date must be earlier than or same as t...
entry.content:
Hello @Uddhav_B ,

Below is detailed explanation of your issue with possible solutions.

 

TopicDetailed ExplanationRequired Action / Recommended Fix
What the Error MeansSAP checks that every asset's Capitalization Date is ≤ Legacy Transfer Date (LTD). If even one asset has a later date, the entire upload fails. This rule is strict in Public Cloud and cannot be overridden.Ensure that all capitalization dates in the template are on or before the LTD configured in the migration settings.
Why the Error HappensThe migration template contains a capitalization date such as 2025-04-05 while the LTD is 2025-03-31. Even a 1-day difference causes a hard stop. SAP prevents importing assets with a historical inconsistency.Either adjust the asset date or move the LTD forward (e.g., from March 31 to April 30, 2025).
SAP Public Cloud LimitationThe Public Cloud prohibits changing the LTD in the asset record during upload. LTD is a global parameter and enforced for all migration objects. You also cannot disable or relax the validation.You must fix date mismatches either in configuration (LTD) or in the file. There is no system override option.
Dates Validated by the System (All Must Be ≤ LTD)SAP validates multiple fields, not just capitalization date: • Capitalization Date • In-Service Date • Acquisition Date • Posting Date • Quantity/technical capitalization date • Asset movement/APC date If ANY of these exceeds LTD, the error occurs.Review and correct all date fields in your migration template. Not just capitalization date.
Hidden Causes (Often Missed)• Blank In-Service Date → SAP interprets as 9999-12-31 • Excel auto-fills today’s date in Acquisition Date • AUC assets created after LTD • Sub-assets having different cap dates • Migration template copied from ECC with future datesManually enter correct values; do not leave blank dates; verify sub-assets individually.
Solution 1: Adjust Legacy Transfer DateIf your Customer has assets created after the planned LTD, you must move LTD forward. Example: LTD = 2025-03-31 but assets created in April → error.Change LTD in configuration (or migration project) to match the latest asset capitalization date (e.g., set LTD = 2025-06-30).
Solution 2: Correct Template DatesIf the asset truly existed before LTD, but template dates are wrong or inconsistent, update them. Many customers mistakenly enter posting date instead of capitalization date.Modify the template so that Cap.Date, In-Service Date, Acquisition Date, and Posting Date are ≤ LTD.
Solution 3: Handle New Assets SeparatelyAssets genuinely created after LTD should not be migrated as legacy assets. They must be created as new assets in S/4HANA after go-live.Exclude such assets from migration. Create them using Manage Fixed Assets after go-live.
Solution 4: Change LTD Within Migration ProjectIn some versions, the LTD is visible under the Parameters tab of the migration object. You can set a new LTD here without changing configuration.Open Migration Cockpit → Fixed Assets object → Parameters → Adjust LTD.
Solution 5: AUC-Specific HandlingAUC assets often have capitalization dates in the future because they are still under construction. SAP treats these dates strictly.Either adjust AUC dates to meet LTD or migrate AUC separately post go-live.
Checklist Before UploadBefore uploading, verify the following for each asset: ✅ Capitalization Date ≤ LTD ✅ In-Service Date ≤ LTD ✅ Acquisition Date ≤ LTD ✅ APC Movement Date ≤ LTD ✅ No blank dates ✅ AUC dates validated ✅ Sub-assets have consistent datesPerform a full date audit of the template before uploading. This ensures that the upload succeeds on the first try.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Connecting the Facts: SAP HANA Cloud’s Knowledge Graph Engine for Business Context
entry.content: @pramodu - The Knowledge Graph Engine is a native offering in SAP HANA Cloud, and it allows you to store and query RDF knowledge graphs, meaning this is the persistence engine. The Knowledge Graph you are mentioning is the data, and it will be exposed to customers via Joule/Joule Agents, but under the hood. There is no announcement yet on how it will be directly be made accessible to end users, to get their hands-on to it.

entry.title: How to display old material revision levels?
entry.content:
We have created two revision levels (via App Create Material Revision Levels).

However, when we open the material (via App Display Material), we can only see the newest revision level .

 

Where can we see the older revision levels? 

 

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to display old material revision levels?
entry.content: Please use the CDS views I_ChangeMstrObjectMgmtRecord and I_ChangeMaster mentioned in the KBA https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/0003633599

entry.title: Unable to select printer when sending LTSD Request GTS e4H
entry.content:
Hello, 

When we send LTSD request, the PDF document is sent to spool by default. But we want that the user gets a pop-up to select the printer to print the LTSD document, immediately.

We have the following set-up:
Communication Method for LTSD process: Mail
Action Definition: LLS_PRE_LTSD_EU_REQUEST -> Processing Details -> Printer -> Printer Determination 
Print Now = 'X' and
New Spool Request = ' '

Any idea, how to avoid the spool and get the pop-up to choose a printer to print?

Thanks,

entry.title: Re: Customer reference copy from service confirmation to...
entry.content: Hello Daniel, I would recommend you use I_ServiceConfirmation as datasource to retrieve service confirmation header details and retrieve service Confirmation item details using I_ServiceConfirmationItem.

entry.title: Receive by HU - Adjust Delivery line qty - Public Edition - EWM
entry.content:
Hi all,

I believe in 2408 SAP released the functionality for users in the Warehouse Monitor to receive at the HU level. However, if you receive any HU and put the pallet away, you cannot adjust the delivery quantity even though some quantity has not yet been received.

This is an issue as when receiving a container, we want to prevent clogging our dock with a whole container's worth of pallets before we verify the full delivery (or delivery line item). Receiving by HU allows us to verify at the pallet level. We should be able to put away this pallet. If at the back of the container, we realize we were shorted material, we should be able to take this quantity off the last (non-putaway) pallet.

 

In the below screenshot we can see that the putaway plan is partially completed (not fully putaway). Additionally, the quantity on the delivery line item is locked.

entry.title: Re: New Image presented (Carousel) for LMS Admin Users
entry.content:
Hi

There are some instructions on updating that carousel (LMS Admin Home Page) here:

https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-blog-posts-by-sap/improve-your-lms-admin-home-page/ba-p/13535936

 

Hope you find this helpful!

thanks

Chris

entry.title: Re: ABAP2XLSX and XLSM
entry.content: Well, since abap2xlxs has no built in VBA interpreter (a scary idea in itself), this cannot work 😀

entry.title: Re: 🪐 Comet Browser for SAP Users: Practical Browser Automation for Fiori, SuccessFactors & Bey
entry.content:
So, it's clear that this post was written with GenAI, but is SAP really recommending installing an AI browser that can access sensitive internal data, without any idea what happens to it or how the browser behaves?
It's clear that security is currently still somewhat underestimated in the enterprise sector with regard to AI, but this is obviously going too far, isn't it?

entry.title: Re: Mass Assets Scrapping - With posting on a specific ac...
entry.content:
Hi @G_hind01 ,

Try below options.

 

ScenarioApproachHow It WorksProsCons
1. Create Temporary Account Determination (AO90) Variant and Mass ScrapChange AO90 for specific Account Determination key (e.g., Z1) and assign these assets temporarilyAssign affected assets to a new Account Determination key using AS02 → General Tab; then post scrapping via ABAVNNo manual posting; system drives correct G/LRequires master data change + careful controls
2. Use Manual Journal Entry After Scrapping (Reclass)Scrap assets normally using existing AO90 setup; then move gain/loss to another G/L via FB50 / F-02System posts gain/loss to AO90 G/L, then you manually post a reclassificationEasiest, safest, no config changeTwo-step process; more audit trail entries
3. Use Mass Transaction ABLDT (Post Scrap via Legacy Transfer Logic)Use ABLDT (with reason for scrapping) for one-time exceptional postings, specifying custom G/LCan override G/L because legacy transaction bypasses AO90No config changeNot recommended for operational use; audit sensitive
4. Use BAPI for Custom Posting (Z-program)Develop a small Z-program using BAPI_ASSET_RETIREMENT_POSTThe BAPI allows passing a custom gain/loss G/L in accounting tablesCan fully automate and specify G/LRequires development effort
5. Temporarily Change AO90 for the Account Determination and Switch BackChange AO90 for specific asset class → perform mass scrapping → revert AO90Mass changes possibleNo master data on assets changedVery sensitive — affects all assets in the class; only safe if asset class is exclusive

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Call for Speakers - SAP Inside Track Gurugram 2025 - Third Edition
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community! 

We are thrilled to announce that the speaker registration is now open for SAP Inside Track Gurugram 2025 

Event Registration details: 📢 SAP Inside Track Gurgaon 2025 – Third Edition! - SAP Community

Date: November 22, 2025 
Time: 9 AM - 5 PM IST 
Venue: SAP Labs India, Golf Course Rd, Suncity, Sector 54, Gurugram, Haryana 122002, India 

 

Topics for 2025

This year, we’re focusing on curated topic sessions around Business AI in SAP. We invite proposals in the following areas:

 SAP AI Strategy & Roadmap

 Embedded AI in SAP Solutions

 Building with SAP AI Agents

 Business AI Solutions (SAP)

 SAP Business Data Cloud

 SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)

 AI Innovations: Partners & Customers

If you have experience, insights, or success stories in any of these topics, we’d love to hear from you!

 

 Why Speak at SAP Inside Track Gurgaon?

 

 Showcase Your Expertise – Share your journey, technical know-how, or innovative projects with a highly engaged SAP audience.

 Network with Peers – Build connections with fellow professionals, partners, and community leaders.

 Inspire and Be Recognized – Position yourself as a thought leader within the SAP community.

 

 Speaker Registration is Now Open!

 Submit your proposal here: Speaker Registration for SIT Gurgaon 2025

Next Steps: Once you submit your proposal,
Step 1: Our expert team will go through your proposal and if it is shortlisted, we will contact you for more details.
Step 2: This will again be discussed internally with the experts and once shortlisted, we will inform you about the next steps – like presentation format, social media advertisement etc.

We look forward to your valuable contributions and to seeing you at SAP Inside Track Gurugram 2025.

Best Regards,

SAP Community Gurgaon Core Team
